activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shelly S Herring

records.addlTxt:
9:25 AM Defendant Shelly S Herring in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Shelly S Herring.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status. 
Defense indicates they have a letter from the victim and has a counter offer for the State. 
State makes statements on the record. Is asking the court to remind the defendant of the conditions of her bond as they presently stand. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Introduce Certified Public Records Without Extrinsic Evidence, by the State.
and Summary of Expert Testimony of Law Enforcement Officer and/or Analyst, by the State.
of Intent to Introduce 911 Recordings, by the State.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim J.S (person, property, residence or family). Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shelly S Herring in court.  Attorney Alexia Gianitsos in court for Shelly S Herring. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
State moves to strike repeater enhancer on counts 1, 2 and 3.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on July 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
